{"step_by_step_thinking": "Class II division 1 malocclusion is characterized by a normal molar relationship with an overjet caused by protrusion of the upper front teeth or less commonly, retrusion of the lower front teeth. A horizontal growth pattern indicates that the patient's mandible is growing more horizontally than vertically. The goal of treatment in such cases is to restrict the forward growth of the maxilla and allow the mandible to catch up. Cervical headgear is typically used in these cases as it directs the force posteriorly, helping to correct the overjet.", "answer_choice": "C. Cervical head gear"}
